About Celeste¶

Celeste is a python package which implements a set of computational methods which are aimed at automated discovery and characterization of chemical reaction mechanisms. This python package is an evolution of the original Fortran code used in the Habershon group.

Ultimately, Celeste will implement the following methods:

  • Minimum-energy path (MEP) calculations, such as nudged elastic band (NEB) and Growing string method;

  • Double-ended graph-driven mechanism finding;

  • Single-ended graph-driven reaction network generation;

Citing Celeste¶

If you use this package, please cite the following articles:

1. Sampling reactive pathways with random walks in chemical space: Applications to molecular dissociation and catalysis, S. Habershon, J. Chem. Phys., 143, 094106 (2015)

2. Automated prediction of catalytic mechanism and rate law using graph-based reaction-path sampling, S. Habershon, J. Chem. Theory Comput., 12, 1786 (2016)

3. Automatic Proposal of Multistep Reaction Mechanisms using a Graph-Driven Search, I. Ismail, H. B. V. A. Stuttaford-Fowler, C. Ochan Ashok, C. Robertson and S. Habershon, J. Phys. Chem. A, 123, 3407 (2019)

4. Fast screening of homogeneous catalysis mechanisms using graph-driven searches and approximate quantum chemistry, C. Robertson and S. Habershon, Cat. Sci. Tech., 9, 6357-6369 (2019)

In addition to the above, you might also be interested in the following articles:

1. Traversing Dense Networks of Elementary Chemical Reactions to Predict Minimum-Energy Reaction Mechanisms, C. Robertson, I. Ismail and S. Habershon, ChemSystemChem, 2, e1900047 (2020)

2. Identifying Barrierless Mechanisms for Benzene Formation in the Interstellar Medium Using Permutationally Invariant Reaction Discovery, C. Robertson, R. Hyland, A. J. D. Lacey, S. Havens and S. Habershon, J. Chem. Theory Comput., -, (2021)
